results.description:
In this introductory demonstration we will cover the basics of Ethical Hacking for both the techniques and tools used by modern day hackers. When developing software, security awareness is an important topic. Knowing how hackers think, what techniques and tools they use and how they operate is paramount when developing a safe digital environment for your company or customers. To avoid common security pitfalls and prevent hackers from abusing these vulnerabilities, one phrase is applicable: it takes one to know one. In this session we will bring you one step closer in knowing one.

Speaker: Coen Goedegebure (NCIM)

18.30 Food

19.00 Start Talk

20.30 Wrap-up and drinks
results.name: Ethical Hacking: a hands-on experience

results.description:
Program:

18:00 Doors open - dinner & drinks

19:00 Session begins!

21:00 Official end, have a chat/drink

Speakers: Noud van Gemert and Reynier Jonkers https://www.jonkersvangemert.nl/

Noud van Gemert en Reynier Jonkers both are lawyers in Amsterdam and have also spoken on SHA2017 Hacker conference. As one of the few lawfirms in the Netherlands, they are specialised in cybercrime. 

During this meetup they will cover several aspects of cybercrime that are important for us as developers / security professionals. Amongst these are the dangers of (unintentional) laundering of cryptocurrency, the current state of affairs in the world of encryption and (future) hacking permissions of judicial authorities. 

Reynier and Noud will also go into details for the upcoming developments in the areas of computer crime, bridging the gap between technology and the law.
results.name: Computer crime and criminal law 101
